title: Who will win the Women's World Surf League Championship Tour?
preds: Even if CC wins the next one, TW only needs to place 3rd to win.

http://www.worldsurfleague.com/posts/226555/tyler-wright-crowned-2016-world-champion-at-roxy-pro-france
"Tyler Wright Crowned 2016 World Champion at Roxy Pro France"

http://www.worldsurfleague.com/posts/226629/final-day-highlights "WEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 12, 2016
Despite a few delays and a venue change, Finals day was packed with action once competition commenced. Carissa's Semifinal win over Courtney Conlogue effectively clinched the World Title for Tyler Wright. "

Its over.   CC loses in semi finals.
http://www.worldsurfleague.com/events/2016/wct/1512/roxy-pro-france?roundId=7094

Going into the semifinals, this is how it looks: CC must win both the current event and Week 10 to have any chance at all. Even if CC wins both events, TW can still win the overall championship by either:
-- finishing second this week and third place in the final event.
-- finishing third this week and second in the final event.

Here's a detailed breakdown of the World Title scenarios at the Roxy Pro: If Wright wins the contest, then she will be crowned 2016 World Champion.
If Wright finished in 2nd place, Conlogue needs to win the Roxy Pro to take the race to Maui.
If Wright finishes in third (Semifinals), Conlogue has to win to take it to Maui.
If Wright finishes in fifth, Conlogue must finish in second place (Finalist).
If Wright finishes in ninth place, Conlogue has to finish in third place or better (Semis).
http://www.worldsurfleague.com/posts/224348/womens-title-race-takes-center-stage-at-roxy-pro

Courtney just own at Cascais but Tyler got second, so both got further away from the others. With just two events to go for Carissa to win would have to be a miracle, she would have to win both and hope that Tyler would have two results under 9th place, For Courtney though there is still a chance.
Following consensus and especially analysis by @Raisinville. http://www.worldsurfleague.com/athletes/tour/wct
Two more events to go. Check back after next event: Oct 4-15.

After 8 of the 10 events have been completed; 6 of the contestants 8 best scoring events are known.  Restating the standings, to include only the top 6 scores for the top contestants.
Surf.......Best6..........Other2finishes
TW........54,500.........5, 13
CC.........47,700.........5,   9
JD..........45,700........13, 13
CM........39,200.........5,  9 ...........XXXX - eliminated (Best possible score is 59,200 - TW's current best 8 scores are 61,450)
WW.......38,600.........9, 13 ..........XXXX - eliminated Analysis: The best CC can do is 67,700 (47,700 + 20,000)
The worst TW can do is 61,450 (54,500 + 5,200 (5th place in hand) + 1,750 (13th place in hand)
---->Borrowing a baseball term, TW's magic number is 6,250 (67,700 - 61,450) points to clinch the championship.  This can be any combination of TW's improvements on the in hand scores (5th and 13th) or CC's loss of points below 20,000 (two first place finishes) in the last two events.

Best 8 out of 10 results in winner, Tyler has a huge lead and the other two can't catch up at this point short of injury or shark attack.
http://www.worldsurfleague.com/athletes/tour/wct?year=2016
Wright through to last 12, now has 8 scoring events.
Harder for Tyler Wright to lose or for anyone to catch up to the Top 3.
Injury probably only real threat at this stage.
Tyler Wright just own the Swatch event, and Courtney Conlogue got some points to distance herself from Carissa Moore

Tyler is ahead of the pack and already scoring well in Swatch, with a chance to go to the finals. Carissa and Courtney we'll now be very even, Carissa experience must be taken in count, and are also consistent performers in the events to come, but there is still a small possibility of someone else coming back to win this
Wright did well. Ankle wrap seemed to have no effect.

Wright wins Swatch, starting to look very likely as only eight events count and she now has four wins, so a high finish in any of last 3 events should probably be enough. Currently a 13th is her lowest finish so two reasonable finishes in last 3 events should be enough.
Conlogue out in rd 4, Wright into semis, Moore out in quarters.

Fitzgibbons, Buitendag, Quizon, Peterson, Tuach and Hamilton finished with 13th places after today's second round in San Clemente.  Conlogue, Wright and Moore all through to the 3rd round (for seeding only).
I see the smart money has moved off Justice Ginsburg for this year.

Tyler Wright                   43,450 points 1st.
Courtney Conlogue	42,900           2nd.
Carissa Moore         	37,300           3rd.
Tatiana Weston-Webb	35,150            4th It's mathematically impossible for the bottom ranked to win even if they get perfect 10 000 points in the 4 remaining competitions. More realistically based on their performances to date it Top 4  are only ones with a good chance at winning.
8/10 tournaments count for points. Wright has 3 wins so far to Collogue 1.

Update from this week's event:
C.Moore finishes in 9th place and wins 3,300 points
S.Fitzgibbons finishes in 9th place and wins 3,300 points.
J.Defay finishes in 13th place and wins 1,750 points Don't like the current leader board , so I created a variant:
1. TW ... 35,200
2. CC ...  32,500
3. CM ... 27,500
4. JD ....  26,900
5. SF ...   26,400

The Top 3 are only barely separated from each other in points. Courtney Conlogue 37,700= 1 	
Tyler Wright           	36,950 = 0.980106101 % of CC's chances	
Carissa Moore        34,000 = 0.901856764 % of CC's chances The highest ranked of the other contenders is significantly lower ranked. Possible, but very unlikely.
Next event: Vans US Open of Surfing, July 25-31.
